summary:
The Security Council:
 Reaffirmed resolution 1343 (2001) and noted the next review of measures imposed is scheduled for 6 May 2002.
 Noted the report of the Panel of Experts on Liberia (S/2001/1015) and intends to give full consideration to it.
 Decided to re-establish the Panel of Experts for a further five-week period starting no later than 11 March 2002.
 Requested the Panel to conduct a follow-up assessment mission to Liberia and neighbouring States to investigate and compile an audit of the Government of Liberia's compliance with resolution 1343 (2001).
 Requested the Secretary-General to appoint no more than five experts and make necessary financial arrangements to support the Panel's work.
 Called upon all States to cooperate fully with the Panel of Experts.
 Decided to remain actively seized of the matter.
